intro: Hieracium phrygiense, commonly known as the Persian buttercup, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. It has hairy leaves and a basal rosette structure, which helps it conserve moisture. Hieracium phrygiense is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a short-lived perennial.
